message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a computational approach for analyzing linguistic variation among scientific research fields, specifically in five computer science research fields. The focus is on language modeling and semantic change of terms, which are common topics in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) research. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves vector representations and quantitative evaluation, which are relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper mentions potential applications in interdisciplinary studies, which could relate to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
